items.headline: Dow Hits Record High Amidst Mixed Market Performance; Retail Sales Stagnate, Fueling Fed Rate Cut Hopes
items.summary: U.S. equities saw a mixed close on Wednesday, February 11, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average achieving a new record high. However, the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite experienced declines, largely influenced by stagnant December retail sales data which raised concerns about consumer spending momentum. This softer economic data is prompting traders to increase expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts later in the year, with a 36% chance now priced in for an April cut. Conversely, some Fed officials expressed hawkish views, suggesting rates could remain elevated. All eyes are now on upcoming inflation and unemployment reports for further guidance.

items.headline: LPL Financial Plunges Amid AI Tax Tool Fears
items.summary: Shares of LPL Financial ($LPLA) experienced a significant drop, plunging 8.3%. This decline came as concerns mounted over the threat of automated competition following the launch of a new AI-powered tax planning tool, spooking traders in the financial sector.

items.headline: S&P Global Declines on Weak Profit Forecast
items.summary: S&P Global ($SPGI) dropped 9.7% after the company provided a profit forecast for the upcoming year that fell short of analysts' expectations. The company, known for its stock indexes, is also grappling with worries that artificial intelligence-powered competitors could capture customers for its data services.

items.headline: Datadog Surges on Strong Earnings
items.summary: Datadog ($DDOG) saw its stock surge 17% after reporting robust Q4 earnings and strong customer growth.

items.headline: Quest Diagnostics Rises on Solid Quarterly Results
items.summary: Quest Diagnostics ($DGX) climbed 7% following the release of solid quarterly profit and revenue results, indicating strong performance in the healthcare sector.

items.headline: Eicher Motors Leads Indian Gains on Strong Q3
items.summary: In the Indian market, Eicher Motors Ltd ($EICHERMOT) emerged as a top gainer, advancing by 6.45% to ₹7,766.50. The surge was driven by a strong Q3 FY26 performance, which included a 21.37% increase in consolidated net profit.

items.headline: TCS Falls as AI Concerns Weigh on IT Services
items.summary: Tata Consultancy Services ($TCS) was among the biggest losers in the Indian market, retreating 2.53% to ₹2,909.00. The decline was attributed to global investor worries about AI disrupting traditional IT services and ongoing margin outlook concerns.

items.headline: Stagnant December Retail Sales Spark Economic Jitters
items.summary: The U.S. Census Bureau reported that December retail sales showed zero growth month-over-month, significantly missing analysts' expectations of a 0.4% gain. This flat performance is raising red flags about a potential slowdown in consumer spending, a key driver of the U.S. economy. The disappointing data is contributing to market anxiety and influencing expectations for the Federal Reserve's monetary policy.

items.headline: Fed Officials Express Caution on Rate Cuts Despite Soft Data
items.summary: While softer retail sales data is pushing traders to price in higher odds of an April rate cut (36% chance), Federal Reserve officials have voiced caution. Cleveland Fed President Beth Hammack indicated the Fed might remain 'on hold for quite some time,' and Dallas Fed President Lorie Logan stated that 'material' weakness in the labor market would be necessary to support further rate reductions, creating a potential disconnect with market expectations.

items.headline: AI Revolution Reshapes Sectors, Raises Disruption Fears
items.summary: The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence continues to be a dominant theme, particularly impacting the financial and technology sectors. Fears of AI disruption hammered financial stocks, notably LPL Financial, following the launch of new AI-powered tax tools. Google also offloaded $20 billion in bonds to fund its aggressive tech expansion in the AI arms race. Analysts note accelerating underperformance in Technology ($XLK), Communication Services ($XLC), and Financials ($XLF) sectors, driven by concerns over AI's potential to erode traditional business models and pressuring valuations. Conversely, Industrials, Energy, and Materials are seeing renewed leadership.

items.headline: Key Companies Report Earnings; McDonald's, T-Mobile Among Those in Focus
items.summary: Several major companies are reporting earnings today, February 11, 2026. Companies expected to announce results include McDonald's Corporation ($MCD), T-Mobile US ($TMUS), Shopify Inc. ($SHOP), NetEase Inc. ($NTES), Vertiv Holdings LLC ($VRT), Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc. ($HLT), Martin Marietta Materials Inc. ($MLM), Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies Corp ($WAB), The Kraft Heinz Company ($KHC), GlobalFoundries Inc. ($GFS), Stanley Black & Decker Inc. ($SW), and Humana Inc. ($HUM). Investors are closely monitoring these reports for insights into corporate performance and future outlooks.
